alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Ocean, southeastern Mercer, northern Burlington, southwestern Monmouth and southeastern Bucks Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Willingboro, or 14 miles south of Trenton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willingboro, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Bordentown, Beverly, Tullytown, Allentown, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Florence-Roebling, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Crosswicks, Browns Mills, Jobstown, Columbus and Edgewater Park. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 8. Pennsylvania Turnpike near mile marker 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 36 and 38. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 7 and 10. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 41 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Mercer; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth
